Negahban = </b></span><span class="s5"><b>بقلم</b></span><span class="s1"><b> </b></span><span class="s5"><b>دکتر</b></span><span class="s1"><b> </b></span><span class="s5"><b>عازت</b></span><span class="s1"><b> </b></span><span class="s5"><b>الله</b></span><span class="s1"><b> </b></span><span class="s5"><b>نگهبان</b></span><span class="s1"><b> </b></span><span class="s5"><b>استاد</b></span><span class="s1"><b> </b></span><span class="s5"><b>دانشگاه</b></span><span class="s1"><b> </b></span><span class="s5"><b>تهران</b></span><span class="s1"><b>. <br /></b>Tehran, Iran: Joint Publication of the Iranian Archcological [sic] Service and the Institute of Archaeology, University of Tehran, Iran, 1964. •Category¶3§

</a>The Ancient Near East &amp; Asia Minor</b></span></p>

•Category¶3§

</a>The Near East &amp; Asia Minor</b></span></h2>

<h2>



</a>





~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
pages/46 ~ 2019-apr.html

•Category¶3§

</a><b>The Ancient Near East &amp; Asia Minor</b></h2>
<div>
<p class="citation"><b><i>Mythopoeïa: ou l'art de forger les "mythes" dans l'"aire culturelle" syro-mésopotamienne, méditerranéenne et indo-européenne</i></b>. By Jérôme Pace.<br /> State archives of Assyria studies; volume XXVII. Helsinki: The Neo-Assyrian Text Corpus Project, 2018. Small Collection BL1060 .P33 2018. <br /><a href="http://bobcat.library.nyu.edu/primo-explore/fulldisplay?docid=nyu_aleph007341025&amp;context=L&amp;vid=NYU&amp;&amp;search_scope=all&amp;tab=all&amp;lang=en_US" target="_blank">View item in Bobcat</a>.</p>
